description: Easy to work with for catering needs! Use them on a regular basis (10-15 events per quarter) and they are extremely prompt in responding and have great availability.
author: Jordyn E.

description:
2.75 stars. (STORY below)

Visited first-time on a weekday night. Who doesn't love a local, authentic Taco truck conveniently located for a late-night-grab-n-go?

- Ordered 2 Tacos: Chicken & beef ($ 3 each-NOMS). And Quesadillas ($8 for 2). The chicken taco comes w/ shredded marinated chicken, cilantro, onions, salsa, lime, and radish. Very delicious! 

The beef taco comes with diced beef & everything else same. Fresh, authentic tortilla + a spice of mild salsa. Meat & salsa together creates great texture & overall very satisfying. (****4 stars for the Tacos!***)

- HOWEVER. This review is mainly for the Quesadilla. I've asked the lady "Is Quesadilla vegetarian?" The lady said yes. My 2 Quesadilla came w/ NO CHEESE, and RICE + BEANS!? (what kind of quesadilla is this.....it looks like an unwrapped burrito) 

Moreover, the Quesadilla includes a strange-tasting dressing.... that tastes like thousand island.... (By this time I'm so confused by what I've ordered... ***pictures below*****)

- I believe there might be a miscommunication, maybe a language barrier (I do not speak Spanish). I definitely don't think they intentionally did this. However, I was expecting my quesadilla to be cheesy!!!! Even if it was a burrito, it should be communicated to me........... 

- The staff actually answered my phone, when I called to ask for their accurate closing time. Good customer service in terms of being attentive on phone. 

- Taco truck is located in front of Best Buy. There are plenty of parking!!
author: Jess W.

description:
Taco truck right in front of the Best Buy. I want to say that I've seen them before at a food truck event ?

Anyways ... had a carnitas taco that was decent. The green sauce is something you don't see often but a nice touch.

Service was friendly and the tacos came out relatively quick.

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.  

Rod's SF Taco Rankings:

1 El Gallo Giro Taco truck
2 Garajito
3 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
4 La Corneta
5 Chisme
6 El Norteno Taco Truck
7 Taqueria Los Mayas 
8 Garaje
9 Taqueria Vallarta
10 Little Taqueria
11 La Taqueria
12 Taqueria Castillo
13 El Farolito
14 Pancho Villa Taqueria 
15 Taqueria el Buen Sabor
16 Panuchos
17 Taqueria Gudalajara
18 La Palma Mexicatessen
19 El Tonayense
20 Tropisueno
21 La Espiga de Oro
22 Papito Hayes
23 Tacos San Buena
24 Los Compadres Taco Truck
25 Cochinita Mayan Cuisine
26 El Taco Loco
27 Gordo Taqueria
28 Nick's Crispy Tacos

Below is my top 10 for the Bay Area in case you were curious.

2 El Jaliciense
3 Taqueria Sinaloa
4 Garajito
5 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
6 Belly
7 La Corneta
8 Chisme
9 El Norteno Taco Truck
10 Taqueria Los Mayas
author: Rod M.

description: I really dont know what happend but bone fragments in my chicken burrito all through it. I love this place and this was a hige disappointment.
author: Bill H.

description:
We ordered 3 tacos to split for the 2 of us as a light lunch. Carnitas (the best of the 3), then al pastor, and steak

I have never seen 3 corn tortillas per taco (usually just 2).

They for sure lose a star for not just having a regular menu posted - Just a sign with the meats - it was just annoying. Also they lose points for serving limes with the tacos so hard that it would have taken Dwayne "the Rock" Johnson to be able to squeeze them (if they are that hard, just don't serve them.)

LINK TO MENU HERE (NOW was that so difficult?)
http://www.tonayense.com/menu

Also they could have a small table (or a couple chairs) set up for being able to eat them.
author: Amy W.

description: Nasty plain and simple got a burrito and was so disgusting look like diarrhea, will never eat at this taco truck again not even for free
author: Erika A.

description: Tacos are now $3. There are better and cheaper tacos all over the mission. Trucks should be cheaper than restaurants, but these guys don't get it.
author: Keith R.

description:
Be warned!  ADDICTIVE! Super yummy and convenient!
I'm obsessed with the carnitas tacos and like to get a few when I'm nearby. Best $7.50 you'll ever spend for hearty mounds of whatever meat you fancy topped with fresh cilantro, onions and salsa (spice) of your craving. Drizzle juicy lime on top and prepare to be pleased. Super nice people run the truck so if you want a quick meal on the go, stop by and get your grub on. You won't be disappointed. Forgot to mention that it's the Truck parked outside Best Buy on Harrison.
author: Rachel L.

description: EXTREMELY RUDE! ordered via grub rub for pick up, showed up and the lady proceeded to tell me there was no order and they would've called if there was. Not sure who "they" she was referring to. I showed her my receipt but she still looked confused. Then I asked, "well what am I supposed to do?" She then rolled her eyes at me and shook her head. WTF! Get off grub hub!
author: Shela D.

description: Tried the super burrito with chicken. Good food, quick service. Can get the food extra spicy as well.
author: Dhruvil B.

description: During my trip to San Fran I stopped at this taco truck. It was a bit pricey, and a little slow on service. The food was good, but for the price I wish they would have had more workers so I had gotten my tacos faster.
author: Kara J.

description:
I know that people absolutely love this truck, but no. 

I was on my way to Anchor Brewing to pick up some magnums of their Christmas Ale that were set aside for me. As soon as I crossed under the freeway overpass, I spotted the truck (there has always been a truck at this location since I can remember) and parked in the Best Buy parking lot. Convenient as hell.

Carnitas, Asada and Pastor Tacos $2.50 each | I had the pleasure of eating these half lukewarm/half cold tacos in my GTI whilst I stared at the myriad Winnebagos that line the 13th street underpass. I asked for spicy, this wasn't remotely lip tingling. And they don't alternate types of salsa for certain meats. While the pastor was uber greasy, it oddly contained no flavor. And the carnitas and asada were chopped so fine it left no texture for your mouth to explore! I felt like I added a shit ton of lime and still couldn't access that bright flavor.

One positive thing was they put ample meat in my tacos. But, I'm proud to say I've had better from trucks in Sacramento and Stockton and the tacos were obviously (I know SF...shit is expensive) a buck cheaper. You know what makes me forget that I'm spending more money on food? Better quality!

Also, the can of Coke I purchased was warm. Cold tacos, warm soda. Bizarro world.

San Francisco Cheap Eats List: http://bit.ly/2i28uFG
Mobile Food List: http://bit.ly/2hB3PJD
author: Illyanna M.

description:
Taco truck? Naw. More like Burrito truck. I was driving near best buy when I saw this Taco truck. It should be Burrito truck! Anyways, I parked and went to the taco truck to buy a Mild Chicken Burrito and Cold water. The Chicken burrito was $8.00 and the water was $1.50 (Water $1.50? Eh no. I was thirsty so it was worth it). The chicken burrito was filled with cheese, beans, chicken, sour cream, guacamole and rice. Omg this is the best burrito I've ever had at a taco truck. The ingredients were good, the sauce was flavors were good, and the Burrito was gigantic! Be sure to ask for extra napkins! It will get messy!

Overall, if I am craving for Burritos, You betcha I'm going to be back! But seriously, water is $1.50.. I can go to Costco and get a whole pack of water for 3-5$. If I were you, I'll bring my own water next time.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: Been going to this truck for as long as they've been parked at Best Buy.  Excellent tacos and usually very pleasant experience. I've recommended them twice for large events even, but today May 23rd at around 4pm, I dropped by and waited for over 5 minutes, only one other customer before me who left. I wasn't acknowledged after saying hello. She looked me in the eye but said nothing, so finally I just walked away. Usually if they're busy with a lot of customers they'll at least say, "I'll be with you in a minute." I'll never go back and will tell this story to everyone. Lived in town here for 35 years and never been treated this way in San Francisco. I guess I'll stick to La Taqueria for better tacos and excellent service or visit Carmen and the wonderful gang at Puerto Allegre, where they know how to treat a customer well.
author: Richard L M.

description: I ordered the chicken quesadilla and my boyfriend ordered the carne asada burrito. We were the only ones there so both workers were very helpful and personable. I don't usually order quesadillas but it was recommended by the cook so that's what I got. They put the guacamole and sour cream inside the quesadilla which I've never seen before. There was also not very much guacamole and sour cream considering I paid extra for it. The burrito, on the other hand was really good. It was a decent size and both dishes were pretty filling.
author: Jill R.

description:
I'm pretty sure the only thing I have ever bought here in the past 10 years or so is the tacos al pastor. Why would I buy anything else? I claim they are the best in the universe. Anyone who disagrees is obviously wrong. I don't eat much meat these days compared to the average American, but ever now and again I need that hit of primal flavor only meat can provide. 
Umami, umami, umami!
author: Joseph T.

description: I contracted out to El Tonayense for 2 events.  The first one was in July and the 2nd in August.  The woman answering the phone was seemingly nice BUT super disorganized and EVERYTIME I called I had to explain the situation that there was 2 events.  I gave a credit card for the deposit on the 1st event and there was an email confirmation and several text messages confirming.  The day of the event after 6 phone calls she finally text messages me and says that they have no deposit and they are now booked she further goes on to tell me that she has been calling me for two days.  Which was not true.  Luckily with three hours before my event we were able to get El Rancho Taqueria in San Ramon to do my event! They are now catering three other events because they are that PROFESSIONAL and that good! I am so disappointed because El Tonayense was so highly referred!
author: Valorie R.

description:
We've stopped here a couple of times now when in a bind for food and in the area. They take cards, which is super convenient. 
I get the tacos - tried the pastor, which was super dry. Asada and buche faired much better - tender and juicy. The cabeza was a bit too fatty for my taste. 
I noticed that if you don't speak Spanish or request it, they give you green salsa and don't give you peppers or lemon/lime. My first time, I got the White Plate. My second time here, I told them I wanted it hot. 
My wife gets the veggie burrito - it's jam packed, but I don't trust any burrito that has lettuce in it. My grandmother would roll in her grave. 
Does the trick if you're hungry. The wait time can be kinda long. Our first time, we wanted around 10 minutes, and our second time, the order only took about 5 minutes. 
I'm sure you could find better venturing a few blocks until the Mission, but if convenience is what you're looking for, give it a shot.
author: Amy R.

description: I love their taco,very delicious.I just ate in the afternoon,but wanna have it for my dinner.Cant wait till tomorrow I can get it again for my lunch.the best customer service ,I would love to recommend to everyone
author: Ann T.

description: Love this taco  truck. Right at the corner of Best Buy. Great service with excellent food that has great flavors. My only wish is shorter lines and somewhere to eat (I know taco truck).
author: Etienne L.

description: While attending the Lane 8 day party, we of course needed to grub and fortunately this taco truck was right there waiting for us. Unfortunately, we were left unsatisfied from Dumpling Time and needed to satisfy thay empty hole of dissatisfaction. Fortunately, this truck had an awesome deal for 3 tacos. I appreciated that they cook their tacos to order, so that they're as fresh as possible. It didn't take long for us to get our order and by just looking at them, we knew we were in for a treat. I ended up ordering the 3 taco plate with al pastor, carnitas and chorizo. The pastor and carnitas tacos were incredibly delicious with tons of flavor. I was excited that the meats weren't salty and were juicy without being greasy. However, I wasn't too crazy about the chorizo taco. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't rave worthy as well. Overall, I would definitely order their al pastor or carnitas meats next time. Perhaps, I'll try their quesadillas next time.
author: Cristal C.

description: I'm going to start off by saying I moved from Los Angeles, land of good and inexpensive taco trucks less than a year ago.  I've been disappointed with the lack of taco trucks and stands and finally did some yelp research and found El Tonayense Taco Truck.  I got in the car with 4 other hungry humans, drove over and pretty much skipped up to place my order, "three carne asada tacos, please."  Well, we were super bummed to hear they'd ran out of several meats including the carne asada.  We all decided on carnitas and al pastor - some tacos and some burritos.  Then it was time to pay. Um, how can a single taco cost $3?!!?  I know things are more expensive up here but come on now, what happened to my $1.25-$1.50 price tag?  The tacos were very good but for $3 each I'd like to at least have somewhere to sit.
author: Laura R.

description: Good food but it's a bit disgusting to see the cashier handle money and credit cards, and then clean the salsa bucket with her bare hands and put the excess back into the container with her fingers.  Seems there's no health safety in mind.
author: Tony H.

description: Tacos are good not gonna lie but the people working the truck plain out rude and they made me feel very uncomfortable like I don't belong there. Lost me as a customer.
author: Allison I.

description: We hired this truck for a relaxed wedding reception and it was amazing. The crew was on time, cranked food out for hours and was super friendly. I would 100% hire them again for any party!
author: Alex W.

description: Looking at the reviews, it seems as if I might have just picked the wrong thing.  I got a torta and for $7.50 it doesn't even come with cheese, guac, nor sour cream.  The torta itself was soooooo small, pretty ridiculous.  The torta just had bread, meat, lettuce and hot sauce. I guess if I stop by again I'll try the tacos, but this was by far the worst torta I've ever ordered.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: I was craving tacos and this truck caught my eye in front of Best Buy. After my order I waited about ten minutes before hot tacos were served. I really enjoyed the beef taco. It was very juicy and chewy with a great green mild sauce on top. The only thing I didn't like is that the tortillas were soft from the juice of the beef. Is there any way to keep it good and not mushy?  We also got the chicken. I didn't eat it but my brother said it was good.
author: Lilian N.

description: We've been coming here for a quick bite when in the area for some time now.  We always get the tacos, asada, carnitas, al pastor, all pretty good. This last time I actually got their regular burrito, asada with spicy salsa, it's not bad. I wish I asked for some salsa on the side because it seemed there wasn't enough on my burrito. Ratio of meat, rice and beans just right. Although I would probably stick to tacos next time.
author: Naty D.

description:
This review is based on conversation held between myself and a friend of mine:

Yooooooo! 

Did you say taco run?!? 

Game on! Where are we going? You damn well know there isn't any parking over there right now. Insert Yelp tag line of "I know just the place"... We're going to Best Buy. 

Why and the hell would we go to Best Buy for food?!? Well my friend, you just bring your wallet since you're buying. So we roll up and park in the lot, (always plenty of parking here by the way) and hop out and approach "the truck". I knew exactly what I was there for since I have been here numerous times before. My buddy says he's in the mood for carne asada tacos and I tell him, you MUST try the carnitas! 

So he places his order for a couple of carne asada tacos and two carnitas one as well. I step up and order two carnitas, one carne asada and one al pastor as well as a horchata. There were already a couple of people waiting on their orders and before you knew it our orders were up. We had to smash at least one taco there before rushing back to the house to finish stuffing ourselves. 

These tacos come out piping hot and are insanely good! It makes you wonder if there is an underground tunnel leading to a kitchen with an army of grandmas throwing down on the most incredibly succulent meats you could possibly want to taste... Like it can't be possible that all of this goodness is contained to this little truck. 

My buddy has since become a loyal customer and has doesn't have to say more than I'm going to Best Buy for me to yell out what I need in my life. 

With this being said, do not hesitate to give this gem a shot, you will not be disappointed!
author: Josh H.

description: They have great food and the service is quick. But lately the quality and service has declined along with their ability to take cards. The woman was very rude to me and I've coming here for years. Only come here if you have cash and if you want to be treated like cattle.
author: Fonz G.

description:
Messy & Delicious.
I don't even care about the salsa running down my chin.

No, I'm way too busy devouring my carnitas or chicken tacos like it's 1999.

When I was on a very tight budget a few years ago, this was one of my favorite food trucks.  That's saying a lot, considering I practically made a lifestyle out of SF food trucks for several weeks.

A full, absolutely delicious meal for 3 bucks?

Yes, please!

The meat is tender.  It's cooked to perfection.  The flavor is bomb.  

I mean, I totally INHALED these tacos.

I'm having an out of body experience right now.  I'm seeing myself licking my fingers, on the hood of my car, after polishing off my tacos in the Best Buy parking lot.

Ok...
I never actually sat on the hood.

But the rest of that visual?

It happened many times.

I don't ever think about appliances or electronics when I hear the words "Best Buy." 

I think of these tacos.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I've been meaning to try this Taco Truck ever since I heard about it years ago. If memory serves me right, I've had this bookmarked for over 5 years. 

Due to it's location, I rarely go to the area as it's always out of my way. 

This past Sunday as the Wifey picked me up from work, she wanted to go to Tartine Bakery. I took Harrison St. as it was the quickest way towards the Mission District and as I was passing by Best Buy on 14th St., I caught a glimpse of the Taco Truck parked on the side of the curb. I quickly made a U-turn and parked in the lot. 

There were only a few people in line and it went by quick. Like any typical Taco Truck, the menu is posted on the side of the truck. Wifey ordered the Bucha and I opted for the regular burrito and choose Lengua for protein. Aside from the aforementioned protein, they also have Asada, Al Pastor, Pollo, Pollo Asado, Carnitas, Cabeza, Tripitas and Vegeteriano for them plant-eating people. 

Unlike some other Taco Trucks, our order came out quick and super fast. (Take note here) Wifey's Buche Taco was doused with a large amount of salsa verde that it was drowning and the meat needed to be recucitated. On it's own, the meat was OK, but it was overpowered by the sauce. 

My Lengua was filled with inconsistency in terms of flavor and texture. I love Lengua, and I love that the meat is tender, moist and pops with bold, gamy, wonderful flavors....all were lacking in their version. Which dawned on me that they probably had everything prepped and reheated so that's why it came out fast. 

I prefer mines cooked to order so they won't dry while wilting under a heat lamp. 

I don't know what happened, but whatever they did in the past they're certainly not doing it now. I've heard so many good things about this place, but finally getting to experience it left me a bit disappointed. There's better Taco Trucks out there.
author: John G.

description: This is a review for the El Tonayense Taco Truck parked right next to Best Buy. This is the 2nd and last time I was disappointed at this place. I ordered a Carne Asada Burrito (Super), and was given a wet, gushy, running burrito. The sour cream, or some sauce tasted spoiled, and sour. I had †ø return it and ask for some asada tacos as a replacement. I can't believe this place is still in business. They have low quality ingredients, and the meat they use is either old, or just low quality. It never taste fresh, and looks like some ground beef, or some mystery meat. It's ok for the hipsters - they don't know good Tacos if it hit them in the face. Save yourself from disappointment and stir clear of this place. A couple of my friends also share similar experiences. This place has caused people to literally get food poisoning. I remember back in the days, before SF is what it is today, we had great quality taco trucks. Now all the taco trucks on that street are terrible. You can tell the quality and cleanliness is unacceptable for all these food establishments. What's up SF? Let's bring back quality taco trucks.
author: J M.

description:
I've been searching and searching for really amazing well cooked tacos and IT IS HERE! I had the carne asada and al pastor tacos with cheese and WOW! Meat was juicy and tender, full of flavor. So much meat in each taco. Totally loved it ! 
Bang for your buck- $3 each (cause I added the cheese)!
author: Danielle P.

description:
We hired El Tonayense's truck to cater my graduation party last May.  I was so busy that day I barely had time to eat so this review is about their professionalism.  I had like one taco and it was alright.

Firstly, the truck ran out of food so not everyone at my party was able to eat.  We specifically told them the maximum amount of people so there's no excuse for this.  We also specifically asked for tacos and burritos (grilled chicken and carne asada) to be served and THAT'S IT.  These guys show up and they start taking everyone's order off their regular menu.  My guests didn't know any better.  People were getting super burritos and huge orders which caused them to run out hella quickly.  They should have explained to our guests what was available. They also showed up with Mexican cokes and all sorts of beverages that we didn't order and when our guests picked them out, asked them to pay for it out of pocket. 

Secondly, I asked for grilled chicken and the one taco I did manage to eat was shredded chicken....like ummm...ok.

We will not hire this company again.
author: Kayla D.

description:
This might have been my first food truck experience in San Francisco!  Hard to believe when food trucks are everywhere now.  (Or maybe, I'm just old!)  But it does speak to the longevity and consistency of El Tonayense.  They serve up the best tacos with a variety of meats:

Asada - Beef
El Pastor - Marinated pork
Pollo - Chicken
Pollo Asada - Grilled chicken
Carnitas - Fried pork
Lengua - Tongue
Cabeza - Head and cheek
Tripitas - Tripe
Buche - Neck
Vegetariano - Vegetarian

Tacos are $2 each and so worth it!  And their salsa has just the right amount of spicy kick.  After all these years, El Tonayense remains as one of my favorite food trucks.  It's no frills and all about the food!  Can't ask for more than that!
author: Elena N.

description:
Tacos. Quesadillas. Burritos. Make it simple. This is not just a taco truck, this is THE taco truck.

Super fast service, super tasty food. I've had several tacos, a burrito, and if the quesadillas wouldn't have been sold out at 8pm on a Friday, I would've spend my bucks on those as well. 

Where else can you eat yourself through the entire universe of Mexican street food, roll back to your car, and drive home - satisfied, and already planning your next visit.  

Taco-mania from now on.
author: Sebastian F.

description: Best burrito in San Francisco.  Anything their mild green salsa touches turns to gold.
author: E C.

description: Awesome tacos! The guys working are also friendly and awesome too! I got to try their asada, al pastor, tripas, and neck tacos. They are well sized, well mixed with onions and greens, and come with a choice of mild or hot sauce. I went with the hot sauce, but the mild one seems better. I will have to try it next time. I would recommend this taco truck!
author: Michael Y.

description:
Do you remember those cartoons where a hot plate of "something" was permeating with smoke from the yummy fragrance, leaving a trail towards that a character's nose?  
Doing a return at Best Buy, I was intoxicated by the smell emanating from this truck parked just outside the parking lot.  The steak odor was obviously delicious so it was a no brainer walking over as two guys ordered.  After a short menu study, my choices were the Asada (steak) and Lengua (beef tongue) for $2.50 and $3.00 respectively, requesting mild salsa (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).
After about five minutes, I walked through the afternoon drizzle back to my car and devoured them... no, not just ate them, but Godzilla chomped those suckers down!  The big two pluses were that they were surprisingly excellent, especially coming from a food truck and the price.... come on now, what can you get for $5.50 these days!
Will be back and highly recommend if you are shopping at Best Buy or in the neighborhood.  Just follow your nose!
author: Mike C.

description: Craving a burrito kinda late in the evening and everything was closed but el Tonayense. Pretty good burrito that was fresh and full of flavor. Worth checking out if you're in the area.
author: Betty D.

description: i just remembered this truck as it came up on some foodie show. it hurts my heart to consider how much i loved the tacos from this truck and even these things you love and hold very dearly can pass from memory after only 6 years. i miss so many things about the city of san francisco, tacos from this truck are one of them. i truly hope that they continue to serve the best carnitas taco around there. enjoy them if you live there.
author: J R.

description: Wow, the carnitas burrito with everything on it is SO bomb. By the time I was done paying, my burrito was in my hand with napkins and a paper plate. FAST, CHEAP AND SOOO DELICIOUS! Great job ladies. (9 bucks for super burrito & sprite)
author: Madison F.

description:
One of the best tacos in town, period! It's so simple. It's one of only a few authentic "street" tacos you can find in the Bay Area. 

I hear the burritos are great from multiple sources. I can't get passed the tacos!
author: Ben M.

description: I can't speak to the rest of the menu, but the breakfast burrito is absolutely killer. Service is excellent as well- we ordered our burrito and got it in about two minutes.
author: Courtney R.

description:
This ain't your typical roach coach taco truck. 

El Tonayense serves up the best carnitas/pollo/cabeza/carne asada/al pastor/horchata/insertanotherMexicancreationhere EVER.  The tacos are only $2 each and it will be the most flavorful, cheapest meal of your life. 

Park your car at the Best Buy lot and eat these while standing on the street. Casual, uncomplicated.  

Just the way life should be.
author: Janice C.

description: I have eaten here a few times and the food has been above avg for a taco truck. Today I ordered some carne asada tacos(3) and a drink for 10$. Every bite into the taco felt like I was biting into fat. In the middle of my second taco I gagged on a piece of fat that was so huge I nearly choked.  Quality has gone down here.  Also, what's with offering lemon wedges instead of limes on the side ?
author: David S.

description:
I thought I had written a review about these guys years ago but apparently not.
Haven't been in a while but stopped by after a trip to Best Buy tonight. These tacos are, without a doubt, the best in the City. There are plenty of good options out there for good tacos from Taquerias to Tacolicious, but there is something about how amazingly fresh everything is on these tacos that puts them a step above the competition. 
Best. Tacos. Ever.
author: Matt H.

description:
This has been my favorite taco truck for years!!!  I tell everyone about this truck at this location.  I ADORE these tacos..  I hadn't been able to get here in about 6 months, and was eating sub-par tacos in the East Bay. I didn't realize how sad my taco experiences had become until I had an opportunity to revisit my beloved El T on Harrison.

I ordered 3 carne asada spicy tacos, hopped into my car, and nearly wept when I took my first bite. Oh my dear God, with every bite, my eyes rolled in my head. Freshly made REAL corn tortillas, steak that actually doesn't chew like rubber pellets and is tender and cooked to order, radishes that taste FRESH, the whole plate was heaven. I could eat here every day if I lived in the City.  It's just a steak taco, right? But these guys elevate it by making every component fresh and yummy, and the end result is absolute taco satisfaction!!!
author: J M.

description: Sister and I got some tacos today between errands at Best Buy and Costco, and they were yummy. I had a cabeza and an al pastor, and she had a cabeza. 3 tacos cost $7.50- not bad. Very flavorful and lots of juicy meat on each taco. Even though the SOMA StrEat Food Park is right at the corner, this is still a really good (and more cost effective) option.
author: Kathy L.

description:
Best. Burrito. EVER!!! 

I know this little truck is famous for its tacos, but I'm not a huge taco fan. I think they're kind of boring and lacking in ingredients...and if you're super hungry they don't fill you up. I have tried the tacos though and they ain't bad, so if you love 'em, get 'em!

...but those burritos. There's nothing like burying your face into a soft,  warm burrito on a foggy day...in Best Buy's parking lot. Their burritos are very saucy, which I like because it adds incredible flavor, but they can be a bit drippy so neat freaks beware! Good amount of rice, meat, etc. Their combination of ingredients works really well.

Whenever I eat Mexican food, I always hope that I'll be blown away, but I'm always disappointed by flavorless meat, and standard ingredients that fail to impress...but not this place...dare I say it's one of the best burritos I've ever had! I want to go back...NOW just thinking about it! This place is seriously underrated. They need to send out fleets of trucks to cover the entire city!
author: Deanna Y.

description: bad costumer service i would never come back again the lady is just rude she always gives whatever she wants. if i could i would not give it any stars just rude people
author: Iskander G.

description: My favorite tacos anywhere in the city. Two veggie tacos spicy with all the fixings and a bottle of water for only $5. It feels like robbery. It's so unbelievably tasty. I also love the carne asada!
author: Karen G.

description:
Good tacos.  They also have horchata plus other drinks in the shelf by the side of truck.

The buche (neck) seems to be the esophagus and has some crunchy texture to it. 

The cabeza (head and cheek) is also good. in some places they use the term buche to refer to the cheek, but not here.  The asada is good, and the al pastor comes with lots of sauce.
author: Dan C.

description: Amazing Tacos. Freshly made. I suggest always going with the spicy no other way to go. I went with Pollo Asado and Carnitas delicious. These are definitely the street tacos that I have been searching for. Perfect size and and portion. My only concern was the price point however for the quality I was happy to pay for it. This location also happens to have easy parking within the Best Buy parking lot with is a double whammy of your also looking for electronics or some window shopping.
author: Robert H.

description: Not always consistent quality but mostly very good. Staff is pleasant and the tacos are miles better than the ones I've had at the SOMA food truck park. Service is usually quite fast and prices are reasonable. If the quality was consistent I would give them 5/5.
author: Chris B.

description: It's a burrito from a truck for $7.50. Spicy salsa, is American spicy. Burrit comes standard with beans, rice, meat and salsa. Pollo Asado was over seasoned, a little too salty. Truck seems popular as there was a line and a short wait. They have pretty good, quick service. It's parked in front of Best Buy and unless you are buying or returning an electronic device from BB, it's not worth a stop. Once a again, it's a burrito from a truck. You get what you pay for in this overpriced City, even down to the food trucks.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Stopped by after seeing this on Check Please. This food truck is just outside the Best Buy in San Francisco. I ordered 2 super Al Pastor burritos and 1 guacamole and chips. $15 total.

The Burritos were excellent! Lots of flavor, and they have a Mexican Cheese that makes it special. 

The Guacamole is terrible! It's watery and soupy, no flavor. Chips were very lardy and greasy. 

Stick with taco's and burritos forget the guacamole and chips. Excellent value
author: George F.

description:
For some strange reason, 2012 is off to a positive start. 

Usually I would find a taco truck in one of many "Off the Grid" food events. But the mobile taco truck is parked a block away from my house and is located in front of the Chameleon Café on Thursday nights. Truck: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=r0-luNfS5tM2bSo1bCOvZQ

I came here while my laundry is in the process. And I came here and enjoyed 4 tacos at $2.00 each. The grilled steak and grilled pork meats were really good in the warm corn tortilla. (I had outside seating, thus the picture of my evening meal is too dark. My apologies). My treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=UXxn2yeeh3m3KP5xUamxQQ

I also got a Stone IPA beer from the Café. The local beer in a glass is $4.00. Beer tastes great with tacos. 

I also got a couple of tacos for my daughter's dinner after her homework is completed. A treat she can enjoy while watching San Jose Shark's hockey. Her treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=VHCEEgCUBkqpcH3_LHwdTQ

Kudos to the taco truck and owner of the Café: Melody for bringing the taco truck to my neck of the woods. Melody is also trying to negotiate in acquiring other food trucks to park in front of her café. But the taco truck is a great choice.
author: Matt G.

description:
Favorite Mexican food truck in SF. Seriously. 

I usually do a walk around the StrEat Food Park thinking I'll try something new, but always finding myself walking across the street back to this taco truck. I CRAVE their street tacos. I have tried most of their meats, except for lengua... and they're all sooo good! The tripe and carnitas are my go-to meats.The tripe isn't steamed, wet tripe (like in menudo or dim sum) it's FRIED and CRUNCHY with SOO much flavor. Almost like a fried pork skin/fat texture. The carnitas have a perfect balance of crunchy and meaty. It's not too fried to where you're biting down on rocks and the meats are hard to pull apart on the taco. It's just crispy enough for you to know it's fried and soft enough to where it pulls apart on a bite. Ugh drooling. 

Three tacos and a drink will satisfy me. Ask for spicy and they'll throw on some pickled jalapenos for ya!
author: Michelle C.

description: If you ask for salsa to go they'll rip you a new one. The woman is pretty angry every single day. I don't know what is going on. Other than that, the food is pretty good. But watch out for the woman who might spit in your food if you asked for sauce.
author: Jacob J.

description:
3.5 stars

What happened? This used to be one of our favorite places to go for a satisfying and quick meal. Now no longer. I've noticed the quality has gone downhill somewhat. Burritos are still edible but no longer one of our favorites. 

Our burritos came out somewhat dry and seemed to be made in a rush. There was salsa was on the outside of the burrito on the tortilla. SLOPPY. I thought I was imagining things the first time or a rookie made it? But it was sloppy the 2-3 times I gave them "another" chance to redeem themselves. Their salsa is still good with the smoky flavors though and tacos were consistent in quality as before. 

One positive change is they started accepting cards although I'm not sure if they've been doing this for some time now. We always come prepared with cash but noticed a guy ahead of us handing his debit card over to pay.
author: Esther A.

description:
Catered a friend's birthday party. Great food with just a few decisions. Carnitas, carne asada, chicken, grilled chicken, tongue, tripe. Tacos, quesadillas, burritos. 

Highly recommended. Some of the best Mexican I've had in a while in Bay Area.
author: Kevin A.

description:
Food truck heaven. If there was one of these back East, I might never eat indoors again.

Sold out of the tacos El Pastor by 2pm, but the Carnitas made up for it. Juicy, spicy, warm and soft porky bits of goodness The pickled veggies on top included a carrot slice???, but with stuff this tasty, I'm not second guessing.  

The Best Buy folks didn't seem to mind our parking in the lot and walking over.
author: Jeff M.

description:
One of the best, maybe even *THE BEST* burritos from a truck you can get in San Francisco. 

I don't understand them giving me a paper plate though, can you explain this? There are no tables. It's just you, the sidewalk, a great burreto and a paper plate.
author: Justin S.

description:
A Zagat pioneer for food trucks everywhere, I'm so glad I finally got to try the tacos at the El Tonayense Taco Truck by Best Buy that my friends have been raving about. 

At $1.75 each, it's a steal. The carnitas were flavorful and moist. The lengua (tongue) was extremely delicate and well prepared - not rubbery at all. The star without a doubt though is the cabeza. The meat from the head and cheek is just so incredibly tender that it almost melts in your mouth. Three flavorful tacos (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uGM7PAmP2utWXjYcZkVpQQ?select=n4t4ZwTfWHLk0KkWDDGUAw) for a sub-$5 lunch? Score!

It's not fancy eats but it is great quality for little money. The El Tonayense Taco Truck can expect a return visit from me pretty soon.
author: Jon L.

description:
We hired these guys to park outside the house during a big birthday party... What a fantastic success!  Everyone loved it.

The tacos and burritos were great, and they made sure to have lots of kid-friendly beverages.

They arrived on time and were very easy to deal with from booking to goodbye!

I highly recommend this for any function!
author: Josh K.

description: I hate doing bad reviews but damn,all the meats I tried,carnitas,buche,and tripas were flavorless,only reason for the second star because the portions in each taco are huge.
author: Fidel A.

description: Was walking by saw these tacos trucks checked out the reviews, the tacos were delicious, especially Al pastor, marinated properly. Didn't have lengua though, next time hopefully
author: Guillermo S.

description:
Forget Nicks $2 tacos
Forget Jack and a box $1 tacos
Forget any other taco 

It does not get better than this my friend. 

Ive alway notice this truck parked outside of best buy and always choice to ignore it since taco trucks are the epitome of food trucks. One day i want to have a quick bite so i tried it. I was blown away by the perfectly cooked carne asada and the acidity of the lime. It went perfectly with the hot salsa and jalopèno. 

I'm in love with this place. This place has the perfect authentic mexican taco. My favorite place mexican taqueria is El Farlito and i just had their tacos about 20 mins ago before writing this review.

News Flash - This place taste better.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Food: 4 star. Competent and tasty tacos, and a pretty good torta.

Ambiance: 1 star. Aggressive homeless folks nearby.
author: Nick L.

description:
If you know me, you know that Latin food is my favorite cuisine. If health was not an issue, I could probably eat it every meal for the rest of my life. Peruvian, Salvadorean, Puerto Rican, you name it and I love it. Anyway, El Tonayense just happens to serve up my favorite taco in the Bay Area. It's just a truck parked outside Best Buy in the SoMa, but it's probably the most delicious, authentic, no-frills taco you can find. The guys who work here are super nice and never interrupt my miserable attempt at speaking their native language; they just speak back to me in Spanish and if I don't understand something, "Si" is still a safe bet. I also love how they kind of do their own thing instead of participating at Off the Grid or SoMa StrEat Food Park.

How To El Tonayense Like a Pro...
1) Park in the Best Buy lot and bring cash. (Avoid the lunch rush, if possible!)
2) Order the Asada, Al Pastor, and Lengua/tongue (if you are adventurous). Order a horchata to split with someone since it is very sweet and gets to be too much if you drink it alone...hopefully you're not there eating alone. Ask them to separate the tacos on a couple paper plates...this becomes important later.
3) After getting your food, go back to your car and eat it on top of the trunk, standing up. It is most often windy here, so try to use the cup of horchata as a paperweight for the napkins. USE THE LIME THEY GIVE YOU. Sometimes it's a lemon slice. Make sure you each have a plate and eat ABOVE IT so that the taco goodness doesn't drip everywhere.
4) Buy wet naps somewhere because there will be a lingering smell on your fingertips for hours. Although the taco smelled fantastic, the smell afterward does not.
5) Walk off whatever you just ate at nearby Sports Basement or Potrero Center.
author: Olivia V.

description:
The boyfriend introduced this taco truck to me over the Holidays 2012 and since then, I can't seem to stop craving these delicious tacos!  They seriously have the best grilled chicken tacos I've EVER tried and there's a lot of chicken tacos out there.  It's a bit out of the way for me, but I still find myself making special trips to make our orders and then have a side excuse to browse through Best Buy and Office Max on the same block.

The prices are extremely affordable.  I can't remember the exact price but it is under $2 and so worth every bite.  I order two and then I find myself wanting to order another couple not because of the portion sizes but because the FLAVORS are amazing!  It's very fresh and you bite in and you can taste the grilled chicken, lemon, cilantro and onions all mixed together on a hot soft tortilla.  So SIMPLE, so AMAZING!
author: Sandy L.

description: Finally got to try this truck after seeing it parked outside of best buy for all these years. The highlight was the cabeza which I found to be  particularly soft (as it usually) and flavorful (which it won't necessarily be). I had some of the porky ones but they were unmemorable.
author: Misha T.

description: We had their beef tongue super burrito and carnitas and beef quesadilla. All 3 were very good! The quesadilla's cheese was still melting when we got home! Their truck was parked right outside Best Buy and therefore there were plenty of parking;)
author: Anita T.

description: Food Poisoning!!! Beyond sick after eating here. Had the el pastor. Also, paid $8.50 instead of $2.50 like other reviews mentioned. I guess they have selective pricing, which explains why the menu has no prices. Food poisoning aside, the taco definitely wasn't worth the elevated price (or even $2.50). Worst place ever!
author: Ruth C.

description: Why are these tacos so good? I have no idea why they'd be so much better than other tacos. And it's coming out of a food truck. The mystery grows as you learn more about this food truck. I wanted a burrito, and I got one from this truck and it wasn't very good. Why can they make the tacos so awesome and can't make the burritos well? What's going on here? How do they do it? If you need a taco and see this truck run to it.
author: Geoff G.

description:
For lunch on 1-16-2013

After a bad episode trying to dine at another spot, the Mexican food from El Tonayense was calling my name. I had been here before a few times, and I knew I could rely on some solid food. This particular truck is located next to the Best Buy store on 13th/Harrison St.. 

I ordered a super burrito and a cheese quesadilla for my toddler son. Service as usual was quick and efficient. My carne asada super burrito really hit the spot. As always, the food here delivers and I will return for more. 

The location is convenient enough, and parking is not a problem since most people use the Best Buy parking lot.

(+) location
(+) consistently solid Mexican food.

* cash only
author: Denis A.

description:
I love that this place is so close to Rainbow Grocery, so that after i'm done buying my organic veggies, tempeh, kombucha, and sprouted everything into my bag, I feel justified about sneaking over here to stuff my face with delicious, high-in-everything-bad-for-you, juicy, meat tacos. 

Cabeza and Lengua tacos with extra everything is so my jam and total hangover cure. Just sayin'.
author: Clarissa S.

description: If you buy food here with a debit or credit card then say that you WANT a receipt.  I ordered a veggie burrito that was like 8 bucks and the guy asks if I want a receipt and I said "no that's ok".  Burrito was fine,  but when I check my bank statement, they charged me 19 dollars for it.  I called the lady and told her about and she asks me for a copy of my bank statement and all my debit card info.  This accomplished nothing! Everytime time I called back or text she just gave me some bullsh*t story saying it was getting taken care of,   I know its only a 11 dollar overcharged but you would think they would want to keep their customers happy. Never going back. smh
author: Brent G.

description:
Hands down the best tacos in the city. Always parked in front of the Best Buy - I send everyone there for great food, fast service, and great prices!

Tacos are $2.50 to $3 (veggie vs meat). Their spicy veggie taco is one of the best - they have some hookup on their tomatoes - they are always SO FLAVORFUL.

Simple tacos - great service - and perfect price! You can also rent the truck for a pretty affordable price - like $800-$900 for 2-3 hours (great for parties - or in my case I am going to cater my wedding with them).

Also - the truck is michelin rated (no stars - but mentioned in the guide!)

Open till about 10pm most days and nights.
author: Vivek S.

description:
Yesterday I was craving a burrito al pastor and I did  yelp check to find out where to go. This truck is located right outside of Best Buys. It seemed like there was a crowd but I pulled in anyways because part of the reason I wanted to eat here was to let rush hour traffic die down a bit.  

The crowd outside were people already eating. So I literally walled right up to the window, ordered and as my change was being handed to me, my burrito was being prepared and was ready in less than 2 minutes.

It was scrumptious and I ordered an horchata as well which is the best I've ever had.

I'll be back.

Initially I had planned to order, go in best buys to buy a charger, and return for my burrito but it was done as change was being handed to me.
author: Patricia L.

description:
I hired the Tonayense truck to cater a company lunch for my animation studio, and they were AMAZING! We're already eager to have them back.

First, the tacos were so delicious! They get the meat so tender, and everyone especially liked their beans and rice. Pretty presentation too. And can we just say, $2 a taco? It's like a perfect meal!

Elsa, the coordinator, was responsive and professional. The head cook Damon was incredibly friendly and really made sure everyone was taken care of. The prices are awesome, there was no cleanup on our part ... pretty much a perfect catering situation.

Highly recommended! 5 stars.
author: Niketa R.

description:
I keep searching for my go to al pastor taco joint, and I'm just not convinced this is it.  It's good, though the carnitas are definitely better.  The al pastor is just so. . .saucy I guess.  I'm looking for that "sliced off the spit" kind of al pastor that has that sweet crispness without so much orange, oily sauce.
That said - they were delicious - just not exactly what I'm hunting for.  The tortas are very good - definitely a great taco truck option.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
NOW HOLD ON JUST ONE MINUTE AMIGO, don't grow your Mexi-stache just yet. This isn't exactly authentic Mexican comfort food, but it might do for now.

Pros: 
Killer al pastor tacos;
Cheap prices; 
Pretty decent carne asada tacos

Cons:
Salty chicken tacos
Horchata tastes like liquid cake frosting
...errrm, that's it.

It seems like the further away from the border you go, the more they get it wrong. The tacos didn't quite hold up to the high standards of Mexico nor LA (Tacos El Korita gets 5 stars, mmmm hand made tortillas, I highly recommend it). But then again, no one else in the Bay Area gets it right either. 

This place does rank as one of my favorite taco spots in the Bay Area, though. So relatively speaking, they get 4 stars.
author: Abraham L.

description: Buttery dubbery tortilla, with some tender ass carnitas, some special-ass guac (hyper-cilantroed? what is that? I like that!) burrito. Hit 3 tacos/3 meats first and went back for the real deal with the choicest of the 3 meats, need I spell it again? Sit on your car's hood in the Best Buy lot, and eat the cream baby. Not sloppy, not fancy and clean, but this better than best buy is taco truck wet dream.
author: Austin S.

description: This dirty taco truck is bomb. Got the el pastor tacos and BF got beef and pork tacos as well as to pastor burrito. Our new fav Mexican spot! Seriously one of the best tacos we've eaten!!
author: Elle C.

description:
I just ordered this truck to do catering for a work event in Pleasanton of over 60 folks. The ENTIRE process with them was a breeze. Maria took the order over the phone and was super helpful.
Two fantastic gentleman showed upon time (even called when they were getting close!) set up everything in less than 10 minutes and were ready to roll!
They stayed in contact with me the entire time letting me know when we were getting close to our minimum.

Servings were huge, food was great. Everyone was super pleased with the result.

All in all, a really great experience working with them! I cant wait to use them again!
author: Courtney S.

description: Great burritos only down 4 stars though because the guacamole and sour cream is non existent even though they say it's in it. The horchata is homemade and delicious!! The best part for me is the fact the burritos are grilled and not a regular cut of the mill soggy steamed tortilla earns extra kudos.
author: Robert B.

description:
The truck was catering an event I attended tonight and WOW their food is amazing.

I ordered a carne asada super burrito and they gladly made it for me without onions (thank you!). 

It was literally one of the best burritos to have ever crossed my lips. Like I'm pretty sure I reached Nirvana and stayed there until it was finished.  Sadly, all good things must come to an end, and I will be hopeful to eat another delicious El Tonayense burrito sometime soon!
author: Liz G.

description:
Love coming here to pick up a quick and tasty taco. The customer service is actually very pleasant! There's also a good variety of meats or lack thereof (dependant upon your diet preference). 

I believe the prices are on point. The food tastes nice and fresh here.

Definitely give it a try! It's right next to Best Buy. You can't miss it.
author: Ann S.

description: Street Tacos by Best Buy.  Great while you need a quick bite while running errands.  They are really tasty, well presented, bit sized morsels of Mexican goodness!  Super friendly service and quick!  Keep up the great job!
author: Ana W.

description:
Still the best tacos and burritos to date! I've tried many others, but the food here still reigns supreme. The only downside to the burritos is that it doesn't fill you up, but don't let that stop you from getting it because it still has an amazing punch of flavor.

The best part about their tacos is that it's not all watery from the beans or sauce. I've had a couple of tacos that became soggy from other places due to the beans and that killed my meal. These guys know how to make perfect tacos!
author: Richard C.

description: Best taco in town! Juicy and delicious!
author: Mina V.

description: Perfect, every time.  I hit up the Best Buy location in SF/SOMA for lunch frequently (maybe 50 times) and have never had a disappointing meal.  There's always a bit of a line but they keep that grill hot and really push people through it.
author: Big D.

description:
What a fun place!  El Tonayense Taco Truck is not your "roach coach" taco truck, nor is it your frou frou/hipster "fusion-cuisine" food truck.  Simply put: El Tonayense will offer you delicious Mexican food without the formality of a restaurant.

Get the tacos:  My favorite thing to order are the tacos with a cup of horchata!  The tacos are served "street style:" small, flour tortillas piled high with your choice of meat and your choice of mild or spicy salsa.

Quantity: 2 tacos is perfect for a snack, 4 for a lunch. 

Meat: If you are feeling adventurous, try the lengua (tongue).  I've recently gotten into tongue, it is absolutely the most tender meat you will sink your teeth into, as it'll melt in your mouth.  The carnitas (fried pork) was also delicious.  It's a little fatty, but that's the best part, and will contribute to the flavors!

I would recommend finding a curb nearby to enjoy your food--literally street food.  These tacos, will make a mess so be sure to get lots of napkins or pack the wet naps.  Like Carl's Junior ads state, if it doesn't get all over the place, it doesn't belong in your face...and these tacos definitely belong in your face!  So good!
author: Matt S.

description:
I really don't know why people are leaving such wonderful reviews for this taco truck. I've never had a truck and its employees treat me and my friends so poorly or make me feel so sick as El Tonayese.

I've tried multiple items and given it a few shots. Carnitas tacos, al pastor burritos, chicken quesadilla. All of them were the greasiest, most unpleasant Mexican items I've ever ordered, and I'm absolutely huge on Mexican food and taco trucks.

I think the final straw was when a co-worker tried ordering a burrito without sour cream. Well they put sour cream on it anyway, so he took it back to the truck to have them fix the order. When he got back to the office, he unwrapped the burrito from the foil only to find a bunch of rolled up tortillas in burrito form. It was pretty funny, but pretty screwed up of them to do, and I wouldn't have taken it lightly if that happened to me.

You're better off buying a bag of Doritos than any item from this truck.
author: Tyler H.

description: I went to this taco truck today. I said I wanted a burrito with no cilantro (I have a cilantro allergy). They gave me a burrito with cilantro guacamole sauce all over it. Tons of cilantro. So I took it back and politely said that I'd asked for a burrito with no cilantro, so please remake it. The woman, who I think might be the owner, gets pissed off at me, and walks away and says I'm wrong. That I said no cilantro, but not no guacamole. Why would I want no 'fresh cilantro' but want a sauce that's full of the stuff? Makes no sense. She ignored me at first and leaves to go do something else while I stand there waiting. She was hoping I would leave with my cilantro-covered food. She finally comes back, grabs my burrito and chucks it hard into the trash with a disgusted look on her face. They remake the burrito with. I cilantro but she comes back over to me at the end to make a point that it wasn't her fault, it was my fault. And I try to say something back to her and she ignores me and walks away. I can't believe the service here. She's taken my order several times before and made it cilantro free because I said "no cilantro in my burrito". I guess the rules changed and it's my fault I didn't say "please no cilantro, no guacamole if it has cilantro, no Salsa if it has cilantro, no meat if it has cilantro, etc...."
author: Alex S.

description: I always see a line when I come by so today was the day I finally cured my curiosity and I was NOT DISAPPOINTED!! I had the mild chicken tacos which were absolutely delicious!! I am already thinking of what I am going to try next!! If you are in the City, near Best Buy and you are hungry, this is the spot to stop!!!
author: Lo L.

description:
This truck sits on Harrison at around 14th street, just outside of Best Buy. You might not think that it's a great place to get a taco, but you'd be wrong. The tacos here are no frills but hands down delicious, and this is considering my extensive experience testing tacos when I lived in Dallas (which has excellent tacos by the way). I went for the carne asada, and it was fresh and well spiced, with onions, cilantro, and some pickled jalapenos and veggies which were a nice addition.

I haven't tried a burrito, but I expect it to be amazing as well. The only down side to this place is that there isn't really a convenient place to eat. Maybe better if you just pick it up and take it home?
author: Brent W.

description: Best taco truck on the SF side of the Bay. Better burritos and tacos than most sit-down Tacquerias.
author: Sandeep C.

description: Had three tacos: pollo, carne asada, and el pastor. All three were very tasty, and I will definitely be back. It is also very convenient to be able to pull into the best buy lot to park.
author: James V.

description: An all time favorite of tacos done right. For the simple fact to which I have eaten off of this taco truck several times and one of those times being when my old job brought them to our hotel for employee appreciation week... I freaked out with joy. From the lingua and cabesa tacos all the way to the classic carne asada with cebolla y cilantro! Nothing bad ever came from this company that are connoisseurs of the tacos! A must try if you're ever over near best buy close the mission/ potrero!
author: Matthew T.

description: These are among the best carnitas tacos in the city. Better than the food truck park under the freeway, and better than Gallardos' tacos. Delicious, moist, flavorful pork with a wonderful spicy rojo salsa. Simply the best.
author: Jim C.

description:
The first bite will potentially change the way you understand California burritos.  The last bite will make you hate yourself in a deeply satisfying way.

It's hard to get to and the food is greasy.  I actually can't finish the super burrito, both for its immensity and greasiness.  Like so many other places in this town, there is absolutely 0 spiciness even if you order spicy.

I don't understand why people are caught up on its authenticity.  California, like Texas, has a completely unique and equally developed, delicious style of mexican-american food.  If you don't like it, go to f***ing mexico!

This is something to do at least once, and maybe more than that.  It's ALMOST a reason to go to best buy, and that's saying a lot.
author: Nathan C.

description: We used El Tonayense as one of our food trucks to cater our wedding in San Francisco.  They showed up on time and provided our 60+ guests with lots of yummy Mexican food options. Besides being affordable and accommodating, the food was delicious! Everyone was raving about it!  We would highly recommend them and even use them again for future catering!!  Thanks so much for accomodating us and making everything so easy!
author: Sarah F.

description: Love the truck market in SOMA where so many good choices abound, El Tonayense has great Tacos Carnitas & Different Ceviche, I have the Tostado Saplicon , grab what you like find a seat order a Sierra Nevada from the beer truck & you are good to go.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Good if you're not from Southern California.

If you're looking for some decent Mexican food in Northern California, this place is great. But, if you're used to authentic, killer flavor Mexican like you find in Southern California, look elsewhere. I ordered a sampling of meats (5 different ones), they didn't have the tripe when I went, which was disappointing. Most of the meats I had tasted so similar that I couldn't even tell which was which. The meat is decently flavorful, but all the taco is is lime, cilantro, onions, and the meat on a tortilla. And they definitely don't given enough lime.  Some of the meat is a little dry, and so since there's no sauce, it ends up being a pretty dry taco overall.
author: Lucy H.

description:
What's happened? Have they changed owners or vendors?
This was my regular for 3 years and loved it - tasty juicy flavorful burritos and always huge!!
Returned last week and this week - but it was awful!! Meat was dry, lacked flavor, and they charged for a super burrito and didn't get it.
Staff didn't care about what they offered - just clocking in.

A terrible waste of a great brand - won't be visiting again. I urge the owners to review the demise and change it!!
author: Lucy B.

description:
(See pics)

Peter L. told me about this truck but I did not know it's Michelin recommended!

Neat truck sitting among the big boxed shops area. Fast service and cheap! The burrito was so much food it lasted me lunch and part dinner! The food was tasty. The enchilada was also more like a wrap.

While you are waiting, you can learn a bit of Spanish for the meat translation posted on the window.
author: T L.

description:
$1.75 for Mexican street tacos?! Bust out your crumply dollars, jingle your pockets for quarters and bring yourself over to this taco truck. Grab an al pastor or cabeza taco and get em' spicy! I personally would pass on the carne asada taco which isn't as tasty as the other meats/organs. In just a few minutes, your tacos will be ready on a paper plate for immediate consumption. 

Also, for a sweet treat, get a horchata which is nicely flavored with extra cinnamon!
author: Maya S.

description:
Came here on tuesday and the standard beef tacos were simply amazinggggggggg. 2 bucks for a taco? Next time I'm getting three or so.
Service was fast and friendly, definitely worth it!
author: Royal B.

description:
Carne Assad please.

Solid effort. When you hit up Best Buy, have a taco on the way out.
author: Bill G.

description:
All the taco trucks in the bay area lead me back to this one. These are the best tacos ever and one of my favorite food trucks. Restaurant tacos cannot compare.

It's located right next to Best Buy, which is how I found it the first time. Now, I go there even when it's out of my way, and there's always a line! 

My favorite are the carnitas (spicy). It's really not that hot. Also, make sure you get the pickled jalapenos. Those make your meal extra tasty.
author: Mimi V.

description:
With taco trucks all the rage, I always find it kind of odd now when I see a taco truck that sells Mexican tacos.  Don't get me wrong...I think this whole taco truck phenomenon is pretty awesome.  Just that a taco truck that sells regular tacos are becoming (relatively) harder to find!

After meeting up with a friend at the SoMa Best Buy, we wandered across the parking lot to grab ourselves a snack on a cold night.  The tacos are pretty darn cheap considering how loaded they are - $1.95 for a taco chock full of meatiness goodness and topped with Jalapeno strips (we got them spicy).  I forgot to count the exact number of choices they list (maybe about eight?), but their menu offers a variety of meats to choose from.  Since I wasn't feeling too particularly frisky, opted to go with just a carnitas taco, while my friend went for a carne asada and a beef tongue.

The carnitas were really moist and flavorful, although I didn't get much of a bite/crunch that I thought I would get.  Regardless though, I liked the sauce for the carnitas and was really glad that the meat wasn't all dried out.  The jalapeno strips definitely gave it some heat, but not overpoweringly so.  I didn't get a chance to try my friend's carne asada taco, but I did get to steal a piece of beef tongue.  I've had beef tongue before and for whatever reason, I expected the meat to be a little on the tough side.  Instead, it was actually pretty tender.

After ordering, I kinda wish I had ordered more than just my one taco, but I resisted the urge since it looked as though they were getting ready to pack up for the night.  The next time I see them though, I'll be sure to try one of their burritos - with some tacos on the side!
author: Mike L.

description: The best meaty burritos in the mission. Hands down. Order the al pastor super burrito or the pollo asado tacos with salsa verde.
author: Faun W.

description:
Stopped by El Toyanese today to see what all the hype was about, ordered an al pastor super burrito and a lime jarritos. Prices are LOW, $2 a taco, $6 a burrito, $7 for super burrito. That having been said it's nothing too exciting, just your standard greasy roach coach taco truck burrito. 

It seems like most of their business comes from a mix of Best Buy / OfficeMax customers, employees, and drifters wandering under the highway. The burrito was nothing to write home about but
for $7 who is complaining?
author: Tomas K.

description:
Tongue taco!...Tripe taco!...Brains taco!...Head and cheeks taco!
Name an internal organ...they'll put a tortilla around it...Que Aproveche!

Y'know, I think "Check, Please! Bay Area" is starting to become more of an addiction than I care to admit. I've passed by this truck many, many times, but I didn't think twice about trying it until a guy on the show chose it as his favorite culinary destination and even brought sample tacos for the other guests. Impressive...though I was wondering how successful his dates are if this is what he considers fine dining.

Now I'm no snob when it comes to food made in a motor vehicle. In fact, I'm a sucker for the 53rd and 6th Halal Cart every time I go to New York (http://www.yelp.com/biz/53rd-and-6th-halal-cart-new-york#hrid:jVK8_2qtXO3UU7R5hS9XIg) There are three of these El Tonayense Trucks around the Mission, but this one is an instant draw since you can just park in the huge Best Buy parking lot. Jamie W. and I got there at around 8pm, and they were down to just beef as the meat selection.

I went for the $5.50 Super Torta, which came piled with beef and oozing with a sauce filled with cheese, guacamole, salsa, green onions and sour cream. It was a huge mess to eat out of the quadruple-wrapped aluminum foil, but I managed. Jamie had the $6 Super Burrito, and he was having the same overflow issue. We decided to park ourselves next to the wall of the Best Buy where passersby gawked at us. Don't judge us.

FOOD - 4 stars...good, hearty stuff...darn fresh ingredients...need to come earlier so I can pick out my favorite internal organ
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...you're kidding, right?
SERVICE - 4 stars...andale, andale!
TOTAL - 4 stars...cheap eats on wheels...bring your own card table...and folding chair
author: Ed U.

description:
Delicious tacos, I always order 4 of them when in the area.

Lengua, Al Pastor, Carnitas, Carne Asada.

Tasty and affordable at $2 each.
author: Melvin G.

description: I'm so sad. I've been coming to this spot for years, but count your change, and make sure you get your extras before they forget. Or order with Square, so they have a record of what you paid for. There used to be a truck owned by I believe a Puerto Rican guy. He had good stuff, too. Then Tonayense took over. Satisfying burritos and tacos. And I'd 98% of the time leave at least $1 tip for my one burrito or 2-3 tacos. Even before they were ever on TV, and before the trucks were painted with flames. I sent SF noobs to this truck, and after living here almost 20 years, that's a lot of  customers, many of whom became loyal, repeat customers like me. The last few years, I've been paying the higher prices at this truck because I like to support local businesses even though my salary hasn't gone up 30% in that time like the prices have. Now the other day, I was prepping for a looong-awaited court date (I was the plaintiff) at Office Depot making last minute copies and such, and I knew I needed to eat a dose of protein and drink a shot of caffeine, or I'd likely pass out from low blood sugar right in front of the judge. I grabbed $10 cash with not a lot of time left to get to Civic Center. I ordered 3 tacos. It was $7-something. And a can of Diet Coke, which made it $9.35. She gave me the change, and I threw it straight into the propinas cup. I felt bad for it not being at least a dollar, but I was in a hurry and don't think I even had a dollar bill in my car. She said, "Thank you," but didn't give me the Coke right away like they usually do. Fine, I'll stand over by the pick up window and check which court room I need to go to, etc. So my tacos are ready, and I ask for the Diet Coke. He asks me to pay for it. I said I paid for it. There's discussion in the truck. She comes over and says she gave me $2 something change. I said no, you gave me the whatever 65 cents change, and I put it in the propinas cup. She said it didn't matter if I put the $2.xx in the cup for a tip (which I get - what you put in the tip jar doesn't pay for stuff), that I still needed to pay for the soda. But I did pay for it. All I would've had to do was check my pockets to not find $1.xx change because I would've put a dollar bill in the cup, not the coins. Normally, I would've just walked away. Fine, keep the soda. But I was going to battle in court and need caffeine and didn't have time to stop anywhere else. So seriously, I had to argue over a $2.xx soda that probably cost $0.13 wholesale? After a back and forth, she finally gave it to me. I have a hard time forgiving a restaurant something like that. Maybe she was having a bad day. But I probably won't be back. And I won my court case.
author: Myla A.

description:
If you want to hire these folks to cater your next party, it's a hit!! The way I stumbled onto this truck was by attending my friend son's 1st year old birthday at a park. What a great idea huh? From my experience I have had the taco lady/guy cater to many birthday parties before but they only tugged around their grill with some of their food pre-made already. The difference between them and El Tonayense?? Uhh they make theirs fresh on the spot and you have a bunch of choices besides tacos!! 

For one they have Burritos, Tacos, & Quesadilla's. Typically other vendors just serve Pollo, Asada and Al Pastor. This truck had Lengua, Cabeza, Vegetarian, Tripe, Buche, Pollo.. you name it. I ordered Chicken Quesadilla and Carne Asada Burrito. My first bite of my burrito was soooo juicy and the beef was tender. Not a lot of rice which I liked and not too much beans. Some of the burritos Ive came across has too much rice!! and not enough meat. My burrito did not need hot sauce as well, the burrito itself was flavorful and made me stuffed!!! As for the Quesadilla, I found it to be a little too spicy for my kid to eat but she liked it!! hahaha The portion size they served can be for two adults. She only ate two pieces and I tried 1 bite. We both did not finish our food, but I packed it to go.. 20 mins later the host of the party says the truck is leaving in 10 mins so you better get some to go. Why did I go back? hahaha I decided to try out the Lingua. RESULTS? YAY I'm a fan, even though it was my first time to try it. I gotta be open to more food this year. BURP!!
author: Kathy V.

description: Love this taco truck. It's parked conveniently outside of Mission Cliffs, so whenever you're down climbing and lifting, just hit up this truck for some legitimate Mexican food at a great price. The meat doesn't taste as juicy as it would at a restaurant/taqueria, but for a taco shop, it does a damn good job of putting together an al pastor burrito.
author: Danny C.

description:
My taco-loving friend, Julie, has been yammering (and I mean that in a cute, endearing way) on about this truck since I met her. So on a night where booze was the agenda and a little foodish cushion sounded like a wise idea before we consumed our weight in bourbon, we decided to come here and get our grub on. 

I went with the carnitas taco and the 2 carne asada tacos. The CA's were friggin' solid. Meat was moist, melt-in-yo-mouth tender and had just enough kick to keep your pants on, but also get your senses tingling with glee. The carnitas were tasty, but they weren't as good as the carne asada, but I find that to be true at many places. Maybe I am just super picky about carnitas (yep, most definitely the case).

I would highly recommend this truck for your taco-face-stuffing needs. It's cheap, it's easy and it's deelish! What the hell more do you want? 

Yeah, I thought so.
author: Stephy S.

description:
Great food. I had the carnitas super burrito. I'd give it five stars, but I think Taqueria Cancun is slightly better. So with that as my five-star benchmark, I need to give El Tonayense four stars. Still really really good. I will definitely eat their food again.

Oh, and they're open until 9:30 pm at Harrison and 19th (Mission Cliffs).
author: Michael F.

description:
When it comes to taco trucks, this is about as good as it gets.  

If you're willing to try something different because it's delicious, get the lengua (tongue) burrito or taco.  So tender.  They braise it for a really long time to get it that soft.  

My other go-to are the beef tacos.  Nom.
author: suzanne l.

description:
Great bang for your buck. $1.75 tacos and $1.50 aguas frescas (in big boy cups too). On Fridays, they do fish tacos, which were mighty tasty. Lightly battered whitefish with a generous bed of onions and salsa.

Not sure where this truck usually resides, but I caught it right outside Mission Cliffs.
author: Kevin L.

description:
LA taco truck state of mind aside, this place is A-OK.

Probably one of the better taco trucks in the area. The al pastor feels good in the mouth and exudes the oil of glory, and the tripas was crispy and flavorful. Super Burritos are super indeed--quite a combination of flavors mixed in my mouth. 

HOWEVER, nothing on the menu is worth its price. Tacos should never cost $2+ unless you're at Baja Fresh or something. This isn't supposed to be a gourmet taco truck. Conflicted.

But thanks, El Tonayense for a good experience. I'll be back once I have a deep taco craving.
author: Stephen L.

description:
I'm not absolute about a lot of things but I can without hesitation say that this Taco truck has the best carne asada tacos I have ever had (in the U.S.). I don't make that statement without having a lifetime of tacos and street food from Los Angeles to San Francisco. I eat street tacos...a LOT. I work in the Mission. I am fluent in Spanish and enjoy trying as many tacos as I can in my free time at lunch. 

I challenge you to take me somewhere where I can get a better taco. I've been to many of the high end Mexican places in the bay area and LA. You will NOT get a more savory taco than at El Tonayense. My recommendation is to get the carne asada taco with the non-spicy green sauce with cheese on top. 

I can't speak for the carnitas, chicken or sesos but carne asada is to die for. 

To make things even better you can get two tacos and and horchata for $5. And...there is easy parking at Best Buy. So there you go: get your gadget fix at Best Buy and get tasty and cheap tacos. 

Seriously - I challenge you to take me somewhere with better tacos. $5 on El Tonayense any day of the week.
author: Carlos A.

description:
This place delivers on all levels.

Legit truck, weird location, AWESOME burritos and tacos.
I come here even when I don't go to BestBuy or Costco cause it's so good, and I'm coming all the way from the Marina.

Enough said, eat here.
author: Assaf B.

description: Best taco truck in SF. Usually combo up the al pastor, steak and chicken tacos because they're all delicious. Cheap and they churn tacos and burritos out super quick. Hard to make it back to work when you see everyone else shoveling tacos in the Best Buy parking lot.
author: German L.

description: Favorite Mexican food truck in the city, maybe favorite Mexican food in the city as well. The pastor is delicious. I make my own pastor, and so I consider myself some kind of expert. This place does it right. The tacos are legit. The burritos are legit. When it comes to eating with rojo or chile verde sauce, I usually eat chile verde because it's usually done better. Here, the rojo sauce is much more flavorful than the green, and this is the only place where I opt for the red over the chile verde. My only complaint is that they always run out of sauce cups, so sometimes they can't give me any. Oh well
author: Peter K.

description:
Guy: Hola! Como estas?
Me: Bien! Y tu?
Guy: What would you like?
Me: A taco with pollo asado.
Oh yeah, I want no cebollas!
-guy smiles-
Guy: I'll be sure to put extra onions on your taco!
Me: NOOOOOO!!!!!!!
-guy laughs at me-
-me finds out he lied and was just making fun of me-
):

Yay for super nice workers......

Yay for free tacos, courtesy of gdgt!

Aside from the scare and all the grease that leaked all over my plate, napkins, hand, and jacket, everything was pretty good.

Yay for jalapenos that burned the shit out of my mouth and made my face red while I was at my meeting!

Oh yeah, it turns out I checked into the closed version of El Tonayense..... Not cool. It's a damn truck, it's still moving and the name isn't dead yet, how in the world is it closed?!?
author: Elaine N.

description: Tried for THE first time. Had the asada and length taco. Meat not seasoned and warm. No fork. GUACAMOLE WAS RUNNY. Disappointed
author: Cynthia C.

description: Burritos are so-so. But they have the BEST carne quesadilla. They don't go skimpy on your order, and it's packed with flavor. It is a food truck location without seating though, so prepare to use a million napkins and possibly ruin your clothes forever.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Al Pastor tacos!!!! With pickles!!!!!!!!!!

You do want this food truck at your wedding.
author: Anastasia B.
