That's quite an expensive burrito from a taco truck parking practically in Best Buy.Whatever, the burritos are good; but when you're hungry everything is good. The only thing really that keeps bringing me back to this taco truck is that I can have a burrito and not have a disgusting feeling afterwards- like I'm a fat ass.
author: Joanna N.

description: When I bought my car at the Jeep dealer across the street from El Tonayense Taco Truck the owner of the dealership ran across the street to buy me taco's because I was hungry, that was the first time I eaten at that particular taco truck.  I'm not sure if it was the taco's or the salesman that sealed the car deal but I've definitely been back to that taco truck again and again. I always either get the carnitas taco or the chicken taco and I always get the salsa verde with cilantro and onions, I think the salsa alone is worth checking out.  Don't be scared try the truck!!!
author: Michele G.

description: Tacos con pollo, dos tortillas, lime, onion and cilantro - $1.75.  When I have just a touch of hunger and am passing through the neighborhood this is where I go.  There's always parking at the "category killer" and I stop by at least once a week for a taco con...  name your meat.  Sometimes, I pick them up for my boss too!
author: V T.

description: My roommate and I had just finished working out at SoMa Gold's, and she suggested we hit up "the Best Buy taco truck" on our way home. (What better way to refuel after the gym?) Well, not to anyone's surprise, but the truck isn't affiliated with Best Buy, but it definitely is worth the trip. Had the torta with grilled chicken, perfectly grilled, very tasty. Roommate got 2 tacos with carne asada, which seemed just a bit dry, but still good. For the more adventurous, you can go with brains, tripe, or tongue, but all the standard meats are available too... Well whatever you get, it'll be a nice way to seal your 60" hdtv purchase next time you're at Best Buy!
author: Alex C.

description: This taco truck is the bomb.  A fried brought me here a couple of weeks ago, they must know I like cheap but good food :-)  But anyways this truck is right by Best Buy.  It was the first time I ever had cow tongue tacos and I have to say its not bad.  The burrito was pretty good too.  they have this drink there, I don't know what its called but it taste like orage julius and it was pretty good.
author: Tony C.

description: so, im from Oakland and im used to eating at all kinds of taco trucks--- theyre all different in their own way---- I gotta admit-- I love effing tacos---- I stopped by this truck by BestBuy on harrison in SF to give it a shot--- I remember when every taco truck had $1.00 tacos.. they would still make money if they sold em at a dollar, bust most raised their prices to $1.25---  and even a few raised their prices to $1.50 per taco--- ill give them a shot to see-- maybe their meat is just that good!! im not cheap! ill pay whatever for good food--- I.just hate to over pay for BAD FOOD!!-- el tonayense has their tacos set a $2.00-- ok-  fine--- lets see what they got--- yuck-- its not even chopped steak-- it looked like dry ground beef-- no juice, nada--- for $2????? -- as a matter of fact, im thinking of starting my own taco truck business in that area--- much better quality food-- much better quantity--- at a much better price--- If people pay $2 for this crap-- ill blow them away with some real juicy steak tacos--- and to make my taco experience worse-- they didnt have any jumex nor kerns juices which is STANDARD in all of oaklands taco trucks-- I guess im spoiled-- but I expected the most expensive taco truck to be the best-- yet, it was the worst---- ill try em again someday--- maybe theyll change their quality of the food or atleast lower the price to match it----
author: Yelp S.

description:
I had the best breakfast burrito in my life at this taco truck.  It was a work of art.   The tortilla was flaky and gilled to precision.  The cheese and egg melted together in the just the right quantities.  The salsa slightly spicy, the perfect amount for a late morning meal.  It was amazing.  

I've gone back several times and have been disappointed that they no longer carry the breakfast burrito.  I have a feeling that if I go often enough, it'll show up on the menu.   Here's to dreaming.
author: Mike E.

description: best burrito, period...end of sentence. no frills since it does come from a truck so no tables, servers, etc, but the burritos are top notch. if you're in san francisco, stop by the truck. it's always parked outside the best buy on harrison.
author: Tony T.

description:
Now that my younger sister is back in San Francisco for the summer, it's of course my job to chauffeur her and her friends where ever they want to go because they are spoiled brats who refuse to learn how to drive because reading the DMV handbook is too hard for them. This time, I was forced to drive them to Best Buy so they could buy the CD of some 12 year old Nickelodeon bullshit band and get wristbands for a "Meet and Greet" with said piece of shit band. 

I had just gotten out of my extremely boring summer school class at San Francisco State (I mean, seriously, who the hell wants to hear about an 18th century potter for FOUR HOURS) and was hungry as all hell, but luckily I was saved by the taco truck. 2 carne asada tacos with cheese and a soda for $5, thank you Jesus. I devoured them in about 4 seconds flat and felt extremely satisfied. I would've bought two more but I was dragged into Best Buy to pretend like I gave a shit about getting these wristbands. I thought the only way this hell ride to Best Buy would be worth it was if they had the Nintendo Wii in stock (they, of course, did not), but at least the taco truck saved the day.

I wish the taco truck was parked in front of my house so I could get fat on $1.75 tacos and be happy.
author: Alexis C.

description: Absolutely my favorite food in the world.  I eat al pastor burrittos or tacos here a minimum of 2 times a week, and I travel 4 days a week.  Nothing else really to say...
author: David C.

description:
This truck is the best reason to go to Best Buy!  El Tonayense is at the top of my burrito list so far, with El Metate and El Norteno Truck.  I diverged from my usual carnitas burrito to try the al pastor (marinated pork), I was not disappointed.

While the Tonayense burrito might be skinnier than other joints, there is a good reason for this.  The tortilla, rice, beans, meat ratio is spot on.  That means no carb hangover from too much rice, and no gas issue from too many beans.  And with obesity a growing problem in the U.S., I appreciated the lighter distribution of cheese, sour cream and guacamole.  These features made for a well-rounded burrito.

I highly recommend it and will definitely be going back sometime soon.
author: Sarah C.

description:
i'm no mexican food expert but know a tasty thing when i sniff one.  and these are tasty tacos.  have never been disappointed with the standard meat filling options of carnitas, al pastor, or carne asada.

convenient location next to best buy doesn't hurt. makes the mind numbing pain of having to go there all the better.
author: Bonnie C.

description: People call it the roach coach.  But they aint servin roaches LOL. I can eat carne asada tacos with mucho hot sauce all day. Squeeze that lemon with jalapeno.
author: Tae K.

description: Tasty, quick, and cheap ($6) for the regular burrito.  Anytime I'm looking for a quick lunch fix, this burrito truck always comes to mind.  The Pollo and pollo asado are pretty good.  Carne asada is great too.  I've not yet ventured to any of the tacos though.  But i definitely recommend the burritos.
author: Tina K.

description: In High School, I used to rock climb across the street from El Tonayense at Mission Cliffs. I'd climb for an hour and half, work up a voracious appetite and then walk across the street to the little Taco Truck. One time I asked them what El Tonayense means, and I think they explained that its a town, or pueblo, in Mexico. In any event, back in those days a taco ran you a buck. My record in those days was about 6 tacos. I never went for sesos (brains), cabeza (head), or lengua (tongue)*, but the carne asada and chicken tacos with extra lime are just short of addictiive.  *My friend Nicky claims that lengua is the best meat of all.  Now they cost 1.50 but hey, at least its authentic.
author: Sam S.

description: Not the greatest Mexican food I've had but, still better than most Taquerias. The Carne Asada Burritos and the tacos are really good. I would recommend passing on any dishes ordered with chicken, since the chicken is dried out and they try to compensate that fact by overloading your order with Sour cream, Salsa, and Guacamole.
author: Marco M.

description: Make a purchase at Best Buy and then head outside to get your grub on.  Some great Mexican Food to go.  Had a steak burrito and a couple of pastor tacos here the last time I came here and they were pretty good.  Damn Spicy though but hey, most places I go to, when I ask for Hot Sauce, they give me some tame stuff.  Here, my mouth burns.  Prices were pretty good and they are out the door prices so no tax.  Sweet!
author: Mark W.

description:
toto i don't think we are in Kansas anymore... in fact if i close my eyes i think i am in la paz...

this is the cleanest roach coach you will find and the tacos are just a little slice of latino heaven. i am a wimp for spice so i order them *no spice* and get them with a mild green sauce on them that is so fresh and so zesty and so makes the al pastor (my fav) *POP* that i just suck up the fact that even their mildest is pretty hot for my palate.

and the pina agua de frutas is just so... cold and wet and sweet and fruity and delish... it almost makes being drug to Best Buy by the Spouse worthwhile. But i am really happiest when i am just driving by.. like after shopping at rainbow, around the corner, and stopping in for a little treat...

in fact i think i have to get up right now and go... i can hear a tiny tonayense taco calling my name...
author: Sara D.

description: Possibly my favorite burrito in SF (so far). Fast, cheap, and delicious.
author: Nick R.

description: El T trucks have, as the Mexicans say, a je ne sais quoi.  The Al Pastor is the way to go here and yes, it is a greased pig.  But the flavor is outstanding: rich and definitely spicier than the rest of the pack.  Bold.  Complex.  They also achieve exceptional integration of rice, cheese and pork- all in perfect proportion.  Very elusive but makes all the difference when someone nails it.  They always do.  My personal opinion is that they do so by going a little lighter on the rice.  You won't miss it, but the burritos seem slightly smaller than a Taqueria Cancun log.
author: William M.

description: I remember the tacos al pastor were pretty good here, but what stood out to me was the horchata.  One of the best I've ever had.
author: Joann C.

description: still delicious as usual, but as of august 1 they raised their prices just a tad. i had the al pastor, pollo and cabeza (head and cheek) tacos yesterday and was thoroughly satisfied... actually i would not have minded having all al pastor because it was frickin delicious. cabeza was a first and actually not bad at all. the bf had a lengua (tongue) super burrito as well. yum!
author: Andrey C.

description: Best mexican food in the city by far!  Love the tortas.
author: Jamie E.

description: I'm not usually in this neighborhood, but when I am, I've got to stop at El Tonayense. There aren't too many taco trucks that serve tortas, so that is always what I order. The carne asada is perfect and for $4, it's a bargain!
author: Eva C.

description: This place rocks.  Excellent Tripitas and Pastor tacos.  Carne Asada and Buche are quite good as well.  Worth a detour.
author: F G.

description: Yes, I know it's a taco truck, but I used to eat the burritos here.  I hear the tacos are better.  $5 for a burrito is cool, but you can do so much better, that I just stopped going.
author: Avi H.

description: It's not bad but the spots on 19th and 22nd are definitely a lot better. Personally I still wish La Pachanguera was still running that block, they had that shit on lock for reals. Their cuban sandwiches were the jump off and the al pastor was crazy dope.  Whatever though, I'll fuck with the 14th Tonayense if I'm fiending but fuck why bother when just a few blocks away is a better truck by the same folks.
author: Sergio O.

description: There is nothing particularly refined about this place.  It is very clean, relatively inexpensive, and very tasty.  I'm not exactly sure how they do it.  There is a fresh and vibrant taste to all of the products.  The cabeza melts in your mouth, but even a vegetarian burrito is executed well enough to make you not miss the meat.  There are plenty of fresh onions and herbs to keep your tastebuds awake.  I will say that occasionally they are off, and sometimes (albeit infrequently) it can be overly greasy.  I wouldn't specifically seek out Tonayense, but it is very close when I'm at Rainbow or Best Buy, and it is somewhat addictive and one of the best burritos in town.
author: Chris F.

description: This review is for the truck a Best Buy.  I f***ing love this place.  I ate here at least 3 times a week when I worked in the neighborhood.  I still stop by every time I'm in the area.  Cheap, delicious, friendly.  Tacos, Tacos, Tacos!  My boyfriend says the buritos are great too but I have never ordered anything but tacos because they are that good.
author: Alison D.

description:
I first saw burritoeater.com rate this place _very_ highly, but his opinions and mine differ somewhat. This is clearly our greatest disparity yet. Some Yelpers love it too, so that caught my eye. I ordered a regular grilled chicken burrito. No black beans, no problemo, pintos work. Given the vast assortment of fillings, including some this gringo is not at all anxious to try, I understand that they can't have every option. I asked for salsa picante and extra cilantro, no comment from the guy. This was by far the driest burrito _ever_! No salsa, no cilantro, no picante nuthin'. The chicken was dry (but quite plentiful), the pinto beans were dry, and the rice - is that rice? It looks like it's broken rice particles from the bottom of the silo - was dry and had no obvious flavoring, like a Spanish rice or whatever it is every other burrito place I've tried offers. If there was cheese -- and I'm not sure the regular burrito comes with queso -- it was not discernible. I now know to prefer a burrito place where I can see what they've got and how my order is prepared before it's too late. I didn't have that choice at El Tonayense.  What you get is what they want you to get.

I'll give 'em one more shot, this time with a deluxe burrito, and see what happens. I'll update my rating then. Wish me luck.

One comforting thing: El Tonayense has a rating of 100 (Outstanding) from the City Health Department. Those are rare indeed. No roaches in this coach!
author: Sam S.

description: We hired the truck to serve tacos for three hours at a party at our home on the Peniinsula.  They were on time (a bit early, actually), they served great tacos, as well as burritos and quesadillas.  The guys were friendly and worked hard.  The food was very popular.  We'll be sure to use them again.
author: Scott F.

description: Among a sizable laundry list of things I've never done in my life is eat from a Mobile Mexican Gastronomy Establishment. A taco truck. After leaving Best Buy I was feeling a bit saucy so I sauntered over to the truck and ordered two tacos and an orange Jarritos. The tacos came on a plain paper plate with no cheese, sour cream, lettuce or tomatoes in sight. It was freshly warmed soft tortillas, meat, onions, a few jalapenos, and a couple of radishes thrown in for good measure. I didn't know if I should walk back to the car or where to place my bag from Best Buy while I ate or whether to sit on the curb or standing at the truck as I was the only one there. I felt like such an amateur. So, I  dropped my stuff and copped a squat. First bite... Bang!! Boom!! Pow!! Holy Guacamole Batman!!! What have I been missing out on?? I found the simplicity of the taco its best feature.Nothing else needed. Now, I just have to figure out if having discovered such an easily accessible and cheap (4.50 for the whole order) taco is a good thing.
author: Bucky K.

description:
this is the only taco truck i've ever tried...but have yet felt the need to move on.  i've sampled just about every meat on the menu...and have found my slice of burrito heaven...!!
the al pastor (bb-q pork) burrito is my favorite all time (and i  even live around the corner from pancho villa...ssshhhh).  
their hot sauce/salsa has a smokey chipotle flavor which i love too...and the jarrito soda selection is great.
author: Amy C.

description: We hired the guys over at El Tonayense for our engagement party. It was fantastic!! We had 60 people at the party and everyone enjoyed their food. A few people went back for seconds, thirds and fourths. The service was just as perfect as the carne asada and carnitas. If you are looking to rent a taco truck for a party...look no further.
author: Juana M.

description: I am ADDICTED to their tacos. I dream about them and crave them. Who cares about parking and a place to sit? I eat them in my car. Ever since they were reviewed on Check Please it seems they're even more popular. Thankfully, the quality has remained thus far. Yum!
author: meower g.

description:
good
- solid taco truck, but stick to the tacos - burritos and quesadillas are so-so
- next to Best Buy, so you can shop for a 70" plasma while munching on al pastor

bad
- you might buy a 70" plasma while munching on al pastor
author: Anthony W.

description: Best taco truck experience of my life.
author: Sean S.

description: GREAT food and a 100 score from the SF dept of health -- best tacos in the city -- I go here when I every I am in the neighborhood (near the Best Buy on Harrision).  They also tolerate my horrible spanish.
author: M B.

description: whenever i'm at the best buy on harrison, i gotta step outside the parking lot for one of the tacos at el tonayense...love the carne asada and the pollo asado.  chips with salsa are pretty good too!
author: Ray R.

description: I'll admit that I am a bit of a snob when it comes to eating out of a moving vehicle, but my fiance convinced me that I would love this place years ago and now I actually go out of my way to hit up this taco truck regularly -- and I am a vegetarian! Ask for the cheese quesadilla -- with green salsa in it -- HEAVEN! They grill it so it's just a little crunchy and perfectly melted inside. Seriously, it's the best cheesy goodness in SF, and yes, I am familiar with the Mission -- this Taco truck has em beat.
author: LAH H.

description: Mmmm yummy tacos at the Best Buy Roach Coach!  Stumbled upon this gem after buying Ethernet cables for my apartment last summer.  I recommend it to anyone who is looking for a quick bite instead of going to a typical drive thru.  I wonder why I don't swing by here more often for some greasy goodness!
author: Ames C.

description:
i love taco trucks....and it finally took me this long to try the ever so famous El Tonayense! I normally dont come out to this area or the mission very often (prolly 2x a year max--parking sucks and the area is sketchy)...but thank god for this truck parked at the best buy! I can park in the best buy lot, grab a taco or 3 and eat 'em up on the street. 
I had the tongue & the carne asada (mild salsa)...i liked the carne asada more than the tongue b/c it had a lot of flavor to it (and prolly the extra grease) than the tongue. However, the tongue is really tender as well. I took a bite of my bf's cheeks & head taco (hehe, dirty mind....) and that was very tasty as well...i would order the brains taco (oh come on, havent you had cow brains before??? cures migraines all the way thru---it's true, my gramma used to make cow brains herbal chinese soup..never had headaches for years!!!) but anyways, i dont really trust this place for cow brains--its a truck for god's sake...the brains must be fresh, clean, and properly handled!

so anyways., minus 1 star b/c i think $1.75/taco is a little steep...if it was $1.25/taco then thats a reasonable--b/c after all, that stuff to make a taco doesnt even add up to a $1.00?!

but b/c i love taco trucks so much, i'd still come back & i want to try their other items (i.e. burrito/tortas)
author: Yolanda L.

description: Carnitas burrito = satiated bliss. Nothing makes me happier than spending a Friday at home, enjoying an early fall day, and chowin on a fat burrito full of delicious meat, copious sauce, and other tasty goodies. Grab some extra napkins, make sure you're hungry, and prepare yourself for a post-indulgence nap. I promise - it'll be a good afternoon.
author: Matt B.

description: do not pass this place!  had the cabeza burrito -  obviously not your standard burrito.  the rice was aromatic, with a hint of cinnamon.  the white beans were a departure from the red/black i normally order.  just be sure to pluck out the bay leaves.  i'm going for the buche next time around.  also, had the horchata - very consistent throughout.  great flavor, no graininess nor chalkiness.  excellent!
author: meijan w.
